Sources headquarters: wikipedia and own coding from wikipedia map

Change since 2005?: in 2010 went from constituency to county
Comment:
depends on time period you're looking at:
- Under Kenyatta 1 (1963 - 1978), the answer is murky.  An argument could be made for the very local level, the center, or the province (there are 8 provinces)
- If you are talking about the 1980s - 2002, this would be the district-level (there were 41 at independence, 71 by 2002)
- If you are looking at 2003 - 2010, the constituency-level (188 during these years)
- Post-2010, the country level (which, incidentally, are the same size and borders of the country's districts circa 1992)
Sources headquarters: Google maps. List of constituency offices from https://www.iebc.or.ke/iebc/?constituency

Change since 2005?: changes in 2010, reducing the number of local authorities to 35
Comment: only one tier of local government, namely the district and municiapl councils. More information here: http://www.clgf.org.uk/default/assets/File/Country_profiles/Malawi.pdf

Sources headquarters: from OCHA by selecting commune hqs, region and cercles from wikipedia

Change since 2005?: One extra region and 14 consticuencies in 2013
Comment: combined mariental rural and urban as well as walvis bay urban and rural

Change since 2005?: In 2011, number of departments increases from 36 to 63
